alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 20 at 12:31AM EDT until May 20 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 AM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL HARNETT AND SOUTHERN WAKE COUNTIES... At 1230 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Garner to 7 miles northeast of Fuquay-Varina to 10 miles southwest of Cary, moving east at 35 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR Lake Wheeler and Garner. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Angier, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Knightdale and Wendell. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
